definition: to pretend to understand when you don't
(negative prefix)/not/no
to understand/to comprehend
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
to understand/to comprehend

sentences.english: Really is does not understand pretends to understand the girl.
sentences.chinese: 真是个不懂装懂的女孩。

sentences.english: Those who pretend to know what they don't know will be punished .
sentences.chinese: 不懂装懂的人总有一天会受到惩罚。

sentences.english: There is no more shameful act than pretending to know what one does not.
sentences.chinese: 没有什么比不懂装懂更让人感到耻辱。

sentences.english: Try to hear the meaning behind the words without presuming you already know.
sentences.chinese: 不要不懂装懂，尽量听出言外之意。

sentences.english: We’re all faking it, and hoping we’re getting it right.
sentences.chinese: 我们所有人不懂装懂，并希望自己都是正确的。

sentences.english: Remember, pretending to be know-it-all will bring troubles.
sentences.chinese: 切记，不懂装懂会带来麻烦的。

sentences.english: Because he's aware of his ignorance, he doesn't act with foolish confidence.
sentences.chinese: 因为他能认识到自己的无知，不会不懂装懂意气用事。

sentences.english: If you pretend to know what you don't know, you'll only make a fool of yourself.
Unqualified opinions just make a person sound foolishly arrogant.
sentences.chinese: 不懂装懂的意见只会让一个人听上去愚蠢而自大。

definition: to talk big/to sound off/bombastic/grandiloquent
see 半瓶醋[ban4 ping2 cu4]
to like to lecture others (idiom)
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to say what everyone says (idiom)/to conform to what one perceives to be the majority view/to follow the herd
to make a fool of oneself/to make oneself a laughing stock
to take one's seat according to the ticket number/(fig.) to put (things or people) in their right place/to take a general comment as a personal attack
to blow one's own horn (idiom)
to pick up what others say (idiom); to pass off other people's opinions as one's own/to parrot
lit. to play the yu 竽 mouth organ to make up numbers (idiom); fig. to make up the numbers with inferior products/to masquerade as having an ability/token member of a group
to cover up one's faults (idiom)/to whitewash
stupid and ignorant (idiom)
to not know what sb is driving at/to be unintelligible
lit. not requiring a detailed understanding (idiom); only looking for an overview/not bothered with the details/superficial/content with shallow understanding
to not fully understand/to only partly understand
to have high standards but little ability/to be fastidious but incompetent (idiom)
